dublin_core.dcvalue: The introduction of the laparoscope led to the progress of surgery to a new era where surgeries that were deemed major are now being performed through keyhole incisions with comparable outcomes to open surgery However with this new technique rose several problems like inaccurate depth perception diminished tactile feedback need for experienced assistance and reduction in degrees of motion of the surgeons hands all of which inspired surgeons and engineers to look for mechanical tools to help in reducing these problems Henceforth came the application of robotics in surgery
The international journal of medical robotics + computer assisted surgery : MRCAS
Cardiac robotics: a review and St. Mary's experience.
